results.title: Golden jungle tales
results.brief_description: Includes 3 stories from the Golden Book series. “The Saggy baggy elephant”: a parrot questions the elephant as to who he is, this sparks a journey of discovery into the jungle; “The Tawny scrawny lion”; the jungle animals devise a plan for a jungle free of the noise of the lion chasing animals; “Rupert the rhinoceros”; Rupert needs help, everytime someone comes near him he charges them.

results.title: Golden greats of golf
results.brief_description: For over 450 years it has been a game of ultimate challenge and skill. Many have tried to master it, but only a few have truly conquered the sport. Some of the names include Sarazen, Jones, Hogan, Nelson, Demaret, Berg, Snead, Palmer, Nicklaus, Player, Casper and Trevino. With the power of their drives, accuracy of their irons and touch of their putters.. they have become legends. Who could ever forget the kind of year Byron Nelson had in 1945 when he won 13 of 19 tournaments. or how about Billy Caspers incredible comeback victory over Arnold Palmer at the 1966 U.S. Open.

results.title: Golden Dart Huang Tianba = Jin Biao Huang Tian Ba
results.creator_credit: Li Wenhua and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Synopsis:
The film tells the story of a legendary figure Huang Tianba in the Qing Dynasty. Huang Tianba is a kung fu master and a sworn brother of three forest outlaws. The newly-appointed governor of Yangzhou caught Huang’s big brother and executed him. Huang plotted an assassination of the local governor after he failed to rescue his big brother. A girl went to assassinate the local governor with her father on the same night as Huang, and mistakenly took Huang as the governor’s body guard. By the time they knew the identity of each other, the two were surrounded by a large troop. Huang helped the girl escape but was caught by the troop. To Huang’s surprise, the local governor set him free and let him go back home to see his dying father. Huang’s father hoped his son to break away with the bandits and work for the government. The local governor caught Huang again on his father’s funeral day and lured Huang with official title and a promising future. Huang was struggling in mind but eventually took the offer. He then was assigned to escort a large amount of silver to the emperor by the governor. Huang’s team was attacked by bandits on their way to the capital. The attackers were actually the girl Huang had saved and a group of forest outlaws led by the girl’s father. The girl let Huang and his team go for she adored him for saving her life. The local governor was kidnapped by Huang’s sworn brothers while Huang was away. Huang hurried back to rescue the governor with a troop and fought with his sworn brothers. Huang betrayed his oath to rebel against the government and killed his brothers and their families. Huang was promoted by the emperor for eliminating the forest outlaws at the end of the film.

Cultural History of the Film:
The director of the film, Li Wenhua worked as a cameraman in his early career. He was the cinematographer of well-known films such as, The Red Detachment of Women (1970) and Threshold of Spring (1962).

Researcher’s Comments:
Huang Tianba is a legendary figure, and his story, based on some true history, has been adapted to Beijing Opera.

(3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)

results.title: Golden braid
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Santhana Naidu, Paul Ammitzboll, Film Victoria and Illumination Films (AU)
results.brief_description: Bernard is an eccentric clockmaker; Terese is the sultry young Salvation Army worker with whom he is having an affair. Obsessed by the past, he finds a golden braid in an 18th century cabinet and immerses himself in the pursuit of a fantasy. It is up to Terese to lure him away from the ghost of the past, reignite their passion and seduce him back to reality.

results.title: Golden beginnings
results.brief_description: Traces the development of Ballarat from the first gold strike in 1851 and the mining period that followed, through its early industrial growth to its present position as a prosperous industrial city. Narrated by John Collins. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Golden Bay
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Stanhope Andrews and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A social study of the occupations, leisure activities, community life and local government of the people of Takaka (South Island, New Zealand) and its surrounding district, Golden Bay. Farming is the main business of the people but the area is linked historically with Abel Tasman’s discovery of New Zealand.

results.title: Gold!
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten, WQED and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: A journey to various parts of the world to discover how gold is mined, transported, and used, and how it affects our daily lives. Not central to any one subject area but useful as a resource for studies of monetary systems, prejudices, values, religious aspects, etc. Narrated by E.G. Marshall. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Gold the sacred metal
results.creator_credit: Jeri Sopanen, Lewis Bushnell and Kena Productions
results.brief_description: This film is about gold and what people will do for and with it. For gold, the Conquistadors waged wars and with their superior weapons defeated the Latin American Indians. The film shows the descendants of these Indians, the Koguis, who still survive in small villages. Twice a year they dance with golden masks.

results.title: Gold on blue
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A look at the training and life-styles of the young men who enter “Cresswell”, the Royal Australian Naval College, near Nowra, N.S.W. Shows various aspects of the college from which they will graduate as junior officers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cecil Holmes, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
